value.name: Federal Judge In Houston Orders Review Of Harding Street Raid Evidence In Lawsuit
value.description: The ruling came during the civil case filed by the family of Pecan Park residents Dennis Tuttle and Rhogena Nichols, who were shot and killed during a no-knock drug raid orchestrated by disgraced former Houston Police officer Gerald Goines.

value.name: Prosecutors in Harding Street raid seek to delay federal civil trial
value.description: Prosecutors fear findings of a civil trial could upend their case in the criminal trial against HPD officers in the no-knock raid.

video.name: Prosecutors in raid seek to delay federal civil trial

value.name: Judge hears arguments to delay Harding Street lawsuit
value.description: Attorneys for relatives of two people killed in a fraudulent 2019 drug raid asked a federal judge Monday to shoot down a bid from Harris County prosecutors to halt a civil lawsuit against officers involved in the incident until they’ve been tried in court.

value.name: Harris County Leaders Back Pardoning George Floyd For 2004 Drug Arrest
value.description: The five members of Harris County Commissioners Court unanimously approved the resolution in support of the pardon request, which was submitted last month to the Texas Board of Pardons and Paroles.

value.name: Texas officials back pardoning George Floyd for 2004 drug arrest
value.description: Top leaders in the Texas county where George Floyd grew up are supporting a resolution calling for him to be posthumously pardoned for a 2004 drug arrest by a former Houston police officer now facing murder charges in a separate case.

value.name: Harris Co. Commissioners support pardoning George Floyd for 2004 drug arrest
value.description: Top leaders in the Texas county where George Floyd grew up are supporting a resolution calling for him to be posthumously pardoned for a 2004 drug arrest by a former Houston police officer now facing murder charges in a separate case.
